intro: Allionia petrophila, commonly known as the rock onion, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous roots and grass-like leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. Allionia petrophila is adapted to partial shade and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
